 -Justifications : a|Type|Pepper, Pepper|SubClassOf|Agent, a|hasCapability|ta, PerceivingCapability|EquivalentTo|(isCapabilityOf some (hasComponent some (Camera and (isActive value boolean#true)), ta|isCapabilityOf|a, a|hasComponent|ev, ev|Type|RealsenseD435i, RealsenseD435i|SubClassOf|Camera, ev|isActive|boolean#true, dpi|Type|Appliance, Appliance|SubClassOf|Object, dpi|hasDisposition|h, PerceivingDisposition|EquivalentTo|(isDispositionOf some (hasPart some (ScannablePart and (isRegistered value boolean#true))), h|isDispositionOf|dpi, dpi|hasPart|rumm, rumm|Type|2DBarcode, 2DBarcode|SubClassOf|ScannablePart, rumm|isRegistered|boolean#true, (hasScannableCode o isInFrontOf)|SubPropertyOf|isVisibleBy, dpi|hasScannableCode|rumm, rumm|isInFrontOf|a, ev|Type|RealsenseD435i, RealsenseD435i|SubClassOf|Camera, a|hasComponent|ev, ev|hasMaximumDistanceRange|integer#78, dpi|isAtDistance|integer#58, greaterThan(integer#78,integer#58). -Rule : Agent(?a), hasCapability(?a, ?c), PerceivingCapability(?c), Object(?o), hasDisposition(?o, ?d), PerceivingDisposition(?d),                 isVisibleBy(?o,?a), Camera(?g), hasComponent(?a,?g), hasMaximumDistanceRange(?g,?w1), isAtDistance(?o,?w2), greaterThan(?w1,?w2) -> canPerceive(?a, ?o).
answers.answer: the pepper robot can perceive the appliance because it has a perceiving capability thanks to its active camera and the appliance being in front of it with a scannable code that is registered, and the distance between them is within the camera's maximum range.

answers.answer: the Tiago can perceive the book because it has a perceiving capability thanks to its active RGB camera and the book has a perceiving disposition due to its scannable QR code being registered and in front of the robot, with the distance between them being within the camera's range.

 -Justifications : h|Type|Pr2, Pr2|SubClassOf|Agent, h|hasCapability|b, PerceivingCapability|EquivalentTo|(isCapabilityOf some (hasComponent some (Camera and (isActive value boolean#true)), b|isCapabilityOf|h, h|hasComponent|ugx, ugx|Type|KinectV2, KinectV2|SubClassOf|Camera, ugx|isActive|boolean#true, oo|Type|Book, Book|SubClassOf|Object, oo|hasDisposition|aa, PerceivingDisposition|EquivalentTo|(isDispositionOf some (hasPart some (ScannablePart and (isRegistered value boolean#true))), aa|isDispositionOf|oo, oo|hasPart|a, a|Type|ScanTag, ScanTag|SubClassOf|ScannablePart, a|isRegistered|boolean#true, (hasScannableCode o isInFrontOf)|SubPropertyOf|isVisibleBy, oo|hasScannableCode|a, a|isInFrontOf|h, ugx|Type|KinectV2, KinectV2|SubClassOf|Camera, h|hasComponent|ugx, ugx|hasMaximumDistanceRange|integer#63, oo|isAtDistance|integer#36, greaterThan(integer#63,integer#36). -Rule : Agent(?a), hasCapability(?a, ?c), PerceivingCapability(?c), Object(?o), hasDisposition(?o, ?d), PerceivingDisposition(?d),                 isVisibleBy(?o,?a), Camera(?g), hasComponent(?a,?g), hasMaximumDistanceRange(?g,?w1), isAtDistance(?o,?w2), greaterThan(?w1,?w2) -> canPerceive(?a, ?o).
answers.answer: the robot can perceive the book because it has a perceiving capability thanks to its Kinect V2 camera being active and having a maximum distance range that is greater than the distance between the robot and the book. The book also has a disposition for being perceived, indicated by its scannable code which is in front of the robot's camera.

answers.answer: the robot can perceive the cube because it has a perceiving capability thanks to its active kinect v2 camera and the cube has a scannable part (the qr code) that is registered and in front of the robot, allowing the robot to see the cube within its maximum distance range.
